image.altText: Aircraft involved in firefighting in Tasmania

props.synopsis: Fires continue to burn in Tasmania's west, with multiple aircraft and ground crews involved in the effort to contain them — with authorities saying they "continue to liaise" with people who have stayed in the area.

title.children: Firefighting effort in Tasmania continues as wilderness areas burn

image.altText: Two extremely cute kittens with dark blue-grey eyes.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's five microchip and registry companies has stopped operations, warning its website is "likely to go offline".

title.children: Microchip data for tens of thousands of Australian pets at risk

image.altText: Wooden boat tied up at a jetty.

props.synopsis: Time is running out for a salvage attempt to recover a 67-year-old historic wooden boat that foundered last week before, as one expert says, the ocean floor starts to "claim" the wreck.

title.children: Salvage of sunken boat must happen soon, or ocean will 'claim' wreck

image.altText: Image of a street sign with Kunanyi Mount Wellington written on it

props.synopsis: Thirteen gazetted Aboriginal place names in Tasmania written in the reconstructed palawa kani language will have their first letter changed from lower-case to upper-case.

title.children: One letter to change per word as reconstructed Aboriginal language evolves

image.altText: The side of a large ship in port.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government has released its revised budget estimates, showing a significant blowout in forecast debt, but the Treasurer has ruled making significant changes to its fiscal approach.

title.children: Tasmanian budget debt to hit $9.6 billion by 2027-28

image.altText: A woman with tattoos outside in the sun

props.synopsis: When Bea had an abortion, it came with a rollercoaster of emotions. Now, she's part of a team helping make sure no-one feels alone.

title.children: Talking about abortions with someone who 'just gets it'

image.altText: A large group of sail boats gathered at see with their sails up.

props.synopsis: Pacific voyaging is being celebrated at the Australian Wooden Boat festival this year, and some traditional experts hope it shines a light on the role ocean voyaging has in the fight against climate change.

title.children: Pacific voyaging shines at Hobart's Wooden Boat Festival

image.altText: An Aboriginal family standing in a supermarket (man, woman and child), holding a trolley.

props.synopsis: As remote communities across Australia wait to find out whether they'll receive federal government help to reduce grocery prices, the NT's largest Indigenous community is finding its own solutions to limit food inflation.

title.children: As remote communities wait for government food support, this town has its own solutions

image.altText: The logos of the four big banks in Australia

props.synopsis: APRA will also clarify that property developers do not need to have sold all units off the plan to get a loan.

title.children: Banks will be told to disregard student loans in mortgage tests

image.altText: A woman wearing shades and a blue jacket

props.synopsis: Journalist Antoinette Lattouf was taken off air part way through a fill-in presenting stint on ABC Radio Sydney after sharing a post from Human Rights Watch about the war in Gaza in December 2023.

title.children: Former ABC chair Ita Buttrose gives evidence in Antoinette Lattouf case

image.altText: Up close of man with bald head in suit stares ahead

props.synopsis: The US Justice Department has ordered federal prosecutors to drop corruption charges against New York City Mayor Eric Adams.

title.children: US federal prosecutors ordered to drop corruption charges against New York Mayor

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair looks serious.

props.synopsis: Rent crisis among the lowest-income First Nations households as new research drills down on the 'unmet' housing needs.

title.children: The stress of finding an affordable home. What could help First Nations people?

image.altText: Cassius holds a sign with his name on it that he welded

props.synopsis: Prosecutors make it clear they believe the motive for the alleged murder of Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey was not racism.

title.children: Cassius Turvey's alleged murder not racially motivated, state says

image.altText: Aircraft involved in firefighting in Tasmania

props.synopsis: Fires are burning in Tasmania's west, with multiple aircraft and ground crews involved in the effort to contain them — with authorities saying they "continue to liaise" with people who have stayed in the area.

title.children: Firefighting efforts in Tasmania intensify as wilderness areas burn

image.altText: 2025-01-30T204648Z_256776295_RC2KKCA2F3WR_RTRMADP_3_USA-TRUMP

props.synopsis: While the news on tariffs may be alarming, given how much of the nation's growth relies on exports, the US is a relatively small buyer of Australia’s steel and aluminium.

title.children: Economists measure Australian recession risk amid Trump's trade war

image.altText: Sam Konstas prepares to play a ramp shot in a four-day cricket match

props.synopsis: Queensland's quicks are made to toil for a much-needed 188-run Sheffield Shield victory that appeared inevitable before some NSW resistance at the Gabba.

title.children: Konstas's trick shots not enough as NSW crumble, Tassie win thriller

image.altText: Head shot of a man with slicked-back blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Kristian White says he is "truly sorry" for tasering aged care resident Clare Nowland in a letter to her family ahead of his sentencing for manslaughter.

title.children: Apology letter reveals ex-cop's regret over tasering 95yo

image.altText: U.S. President Donald Trump

props.synopsis: To understand how Donald Trump's Gaza plan came about, it's worth considering some comments made to a forum at one of the most prestigious US universities last year.

title.children: The world was stunned by Trump's Gaza plan, borrowed from a relative

image.altText: Passengers wait for delayed trains at Central Station in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Planned industrial action that would have slowed Sydney's train services on Wednesday has been postponed for 48 hours.

title.children: Sydney commuters given 48-hour reprieve as 'go-slow' action postponed

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: Protesters outside the North Sydney Council meeting where a decision on a rate increase will be voted on by councillors

props.synopsis: The packed gallery inside the council chambers erupted in boos and jeers as the special rate variation was passed by councillors late on Monday night.

title.children: 'An outrage': North Sydney residents slam 87 percent rate hike

image.altText: A woman looks serious as she walks next to a taller man with a tv camera behind them pointed at her

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr's lawyer has told the court that the police never made any "meaningful" attempt to investigate claims that her client and partner were held against their will by a taxi driver.

title.children: Police response to Sam Kerr incident 'completely unacceptable', court hears

image.altText: Egg supermarket shelves empty

props.synopsis: Consumers are still facing egg shortages and price rises as the ramifications of Australia's largest bird flu outbreak continue to be felt.

title.children: Why is there still an egg shortage on some supermarket shelves?

image.altText: mango tray

props.synopsis: Scientists find the cause of mango twig tip dieback, eight years after the mysterious disease emerged in the Top End. Farmers say the discovery is a "first step" to treating the disease, which can drastically reduce mango yields.

title.children: Darwin researchers discover cause of mysterious mango disease

image.altText: A close-up of an Indian man with glasses.

props.synopsis: After a week of increased scrutiny on GFG Alliance, Sanjeev Gupta says his company is "steadily ramping up production" and asks stakeholders to "work together".

title.children: Gupta is 'finalising new financing' to 'catch up' with GFG's creditors

image.altText: Two women stand with an arm around one another, wearing traditional furs.

props.synopsis: The remains of two Moriori ancestors begin their journey home to New Zealand from the National Museum of Australia in Canberra as part a years-long repatriation process.

title.children: Moriori ancestors' remains 'coming home' after years in Canberra museum

image.altText: Luka Doncic and LeBron James standing on the basketball court together

props.synopsis: Luka Dončić produces 14 points, five rebounds and four assists in his Los Angeles Lakers debut against the Utah Jazz.

title.children: Luka Dončić makes Los Angeles Lakers debut after trade

image.altText: A woman in a beauty pageant

props.synopsis: A judge at the centre of a voting controversy at the Miss Pacific Islands pageant is being held in the host country Solomon Islands while pageant organisers complete "an investigation" into alleged vote rigging.

title.children: Beauty pageant turns into diplomatic scandal with judge 'not allowed' to leave country

image.altText: A sign in an outback town which says "Welcome to Oodnadatta, Australia's hottest driest town."

props.synopsis: Temperatures are expected to soar across South Australia on Wednesday, with several towns predicted to reach peaks above 45 degrees Celsius, including a top of 49C at Oodnadatta, in the state's far north.

title.children: Hot weather warning for SA as high temperature records expected to be broken

image.altText: A close up photo of a man with an eyepatch covering one eye.

props.synopsis: The author, who survived the stabbing in 2022, is due to appear in court as the trial gets underway this week.

title.children: Salman Rushdie's accused attacker on trial in New York courtroom

image.altText: Donald Trump purses his lips as he signs a piece of paper with a thick black marker

props.synopsis: The US president signed an executive order to dismantle so-called "DEI" initiatives in the government, claiming they resulted in "immense public waste and shameful discrimination".

title.children: What Trump means when he talks about DEI

image.altText: An older couple sit side by side in a waiting room, in front of a large sign that says "Medicare Urgent Care Clinic".

props.synopsis: The operator of SA's Mount Gambier Medicare Urgent Care Clinic has entered liquidation, raising concerns about the viability of the clinics.

title.children: Urgent Care Clinic operator in liquidation amid doctor shortage

image.altText: Goalllll

props.synopsis: Marlin Coast Rangers player-coach Crios O'Hare scores one of the fastest goals in Australian football history with a David Beckham-like shot from kick-off.

title.children: With shades of Beckham, a wonder goal from halfway after three seconds in Australia Cup

image.altText: The intersection of two regional roads.

props.synopsis: Afghan national Jafar Bunyad died after he fell from a moving tractor in north-west Victoria. The company that employed him has been fined for failing to provide proper instruction and training.

title.children: Court fines labour hire company after fruit picker dies on second shift

image.altText: beehive striped rock formations behind spinifex dotted ground

props.synopsis: WorkSafe has confirmed it will not lay charges over the man's death at the remote Purnululu National Park in late 2021.

title.children: No charges over death of government contractor during extreme heat
